definition: exactly what one wants
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
surname Huai

sentences.english: His father let him take the entrance exam for the military academy, which is just what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲让他报考军校，对他来说真是正中下怀。

sentences.english: Thank you for the gift which is just after my own heart.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你给我们的礼物，这是正中下怀。

definition: lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
lit. seek but fail to get (idiom); fig. exactly what one’s been looking for
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
to succeed by a lucky stroke
to steal away/to beat it
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
lit. one arrow, two golden eagles (idiom)/to kill two birds with one stone
to come prepared
to strike while the iron is hot
to readily consent
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
